title: 'Jealous' Husband In Japan Makes 100 Blank Calls To Wife Daily, Arrested
content: While his sentencing remains pending, the incident has ignited a national conversation in Japan.
summary: While his sentencing remains pending, the incident has ignited a national conversation in Japan.

title: Australian YouTuber Sparks Outrage After Calling Indian Spices "Dirt"
content: An Australian YouTuber has found herself in the middle of a social media storm after criticising Indian cuisine for its "dirt spices". Sydney Watson's remarks have drawn severe backlash, with users quickly jumping to defend Indian food.
summary: An Australian YouTuber has found herself in the middle of a social media storm after criticising Indian cuisine for its "dirt spices". Sydney Watson's remarks have drawn severe backlash, with users quickly jumping to defend Indian food.

title: Opinion: Pager Attacks: What Next For Hezbollah?
content: In the short term, if not tactically, Israel has been managing to secure at least psychological victories against Hezbollah and its ilk.
summary: In the short term, if not tactically, Israel has been managing to secure at least psychological victories against Hezbollah and its ilk.

title: Ukrainian Strike Triggers Earthquake-Sized Blast At Russian Arsenal: Report
content: A large-scale Ukrainian drone attack on Russia triggered an earthquake-sized blast at a major arsenal in the Tver region on Wednesday, forcing the evacuation of a nearby town, war bloggers and some media reported.
summary: A large-scale Ukrainian drone attack on Russia triggered an earthquake-sized blast at a major arsenal in the Tver region on Wednesday, forcing the evacuation of a nearby town, war bloggers and some media reported.

title: Are Smartphones Safe? Lebanon Pager Explosions Raise Concerns
content: The explosions occurred in various public places, with reports flooding in from grocery stores, street markets, and other busy locations.Â

title: EasyJet Flight Makes Emergency Landing After Bag Of Vapes Explode
content: Eyewitnesses described a terrifying scene, with one passenger recounting a "very large red flash and flame followed by thick black smoke."

title: India Seeks Review Of Indus Water Treaty, Serves Notice To Pakistan
content: India has served a formal notice to Pakistan seeking a review of the Indus Water Treaty, arguing that "fundamental and unforeseen" changes in the circumstances require a reassessment of the pact.
summary: India has served a formal notice to Pakistan seeking a review of the Indus Water Treaty, arguing that "fundamental and unforeseen" changes in the circumstances require a reassessment of the pact.

title: What Pager Attack On Hezbollah Could Mean For Volatile Middle-East
content: The alleged Israeli attack on members of Hezbollah via their pagers is another ominous development propelling the Middle East towards a full-scale regional war.
summary: The alleged Israeli attack on members of Hezbollah via their pagers is another ominous development propelling the Middle East towards a full-scale regional war.

title: Bruised By Election Loss, Justin Trudeau Shows No Sign Of Stepping Down
content: Doubts about the leadership Justin Trudeau intensified after his ruling Liberal Party suffered a second humiliating loss in a special election, but the unpopular leader is determined to cling to office ahead of a looming national vote.
summary: Doubts about the leadership Justin Trudeau intensified after his ruling Liberal Party suffered a second humiliating loss in a special election, but the unpopular leader is determined to cling to office ahead of a looming national vote.

title: Study Shows How Cancer Cells May Be Using Lipids To Hide From Immune System
content: Scientists have long known that cancer cells alter lipid metabolism, but it was generally assumed that cancer cells were gobbling up these lipids for energy.
summary: Scientists have long known that cancer cells alter lipid metabolism, but it was generally assumed that cancer cells were gobbling up these lipids for energy.

title: "Mass Murder": Iran Slams Israel After 9 Killed In Pager Attack In Lebanon
content: Among those wounded in the pager attacks on Tuesday was Iran's ambassador to Lebanon Mojtaba Amani, with Iranian media reporting he suffered injuries "to the hand and the face."
summary: Among those wounded in the pager attacks on Tuesday was Iran's ambassador to Lebanon Mojtaba Amani, with Iranian media reporting he suffered injuries "to the hand and the face."

title: 3 Cups Of Coffee A Day May Lower Risk Of Developing Heart Condition: Study
content: Three cups of coffee a day could lower one's risk of developing multiple metabolic conditions, including diabetes, and those related to heart, by 40 per cent to almost 50 per cent, a new research has found.
summary: Three cups of coffee a day could lower one's risk of developing multiple metabolic conditions, including diabetes, and those related to heart, by 40 per cent to almost 50 per cent, a new research has found.

title: Kate Middleton Makes Tentative Return To Work After Finishing Chemotherapy
content: Kate Middleton held a meeting at Windsor Castle, west of London, with staff from the Royal Foundation Centre for Early Childhood.

title: Google Wins Challenge Against Brussels' $1.66 Billion Antitrust Fine
content: The ruling will be a relief for Google after the EU's highest court last week upheld a 2017 fine worth 2.42 billion euros for abusing its dominance by favouring its own comparison shopping service.
summary: The ruling will be a relief for Google after the EU's highest court last week upheld a 2017 fine worth 2.42 billion euros for abusing its dominance by favouring its own comparison shopping service.

title: Stone Age People Drove Dwarf Hippos To Extinction On Cyprus? Study Says...
content: Cyprus wasnt the only Mediterranean island with dwarf wildlife. In fact, Crete, Malta, Sicily, Sardinia and many other islands had their own dwarf elephants and hippos.
summary: Cyprus wasnt the only Mediterranean island with dwarf wildlife. In fact, Crete, Malta, Sicily, Sardinia and many other islands had their own dwarf elephants and hippos.

title: Trump's Plan To Continue Golf Comes As A 'Bogey' For The US Secret Service
content: The head of the Secret Service told Donald Trump in a private meeting that significant new security arrangements will be needed if he wants to keep playing golf, The New York Times reported on Tuesday.
summary: The head of the Secret Service told Donald Trump in a private meeting that significant new security arrangements will be needed if he wants to keep playing golf, The New York Times reported on Tuesday.

title: Opinion: 'We Lost Her': A Smartphone Epidemic Is Ruining Europe's New Generation
content: Parent-led movements are pushing for stricter screen time regulations, and even bans in schools, calling for comprehensive policies to protect the next generation's future.
summary: Parent-led movements are pushing for stricter screen time regulations, and even bans in schools, calling for comprehensive policies to protect the next generation's future.

title: Kamala Harris' '2011 Hit-And-Run' Is Fake News Spread By Russia: Microsoft
content: A false claim circulating on social media that Kamala Harris left a 13-year-old girl paralysed after an alleged hit-and-run in San Francisco in 2011 is the work of a covert Russian disinformation operation, according to new research by Microsoft.
summary: A false claim circulating on social media that Kamala Harris left a 13-year-old girl paralysed after an alleged hit-and-run in San Francisco in 2011 is the work of a covert Russian disinformation operation, according to new research by Microsoft.

title: Over 3,600 Food Packaging Chemicals Found In Human Bodies In New Study
content: Around 100 of these chemicals are considered to be of "high concern" to human health, said lead study author Birgit Geueke.
summary: Around 100 of these chemicals are considered to be of "high concern" to human health, said lead study author Birgit Geueke.

title: Explained: How Pagers Turned Bombs And Why Israel Is Being Blamed
content: Thousands of pagers exploded within seconds across the Lebanon yesterday in a synchronized attack targeting the US-designated terror group Hezbollah.
summary: Thousands of pagers exploded within seconds across the Lebanon yesterday in a synchronized attack targeting the US-designated terror group Hezbollah.
